This game has a ton of potential and brings a high level of excitement. However that potential and excitement is quickly tempered by gameplay hiccups that on the surface may seem petty. But those hiccups very quickly become major issues. What I am referring to is the bat or paddle as some may know. Like many games out there in the gaming world, a player is rewarded for their effort as the progress thru the various levels.  This is no different. The game teaches the basics of proper gameplay and gradually becomes more difficult as you progress thru various levels. When you win a match you are rewarded with experience points which opens different games and practices. The more you play the better you become. But you will learn very quickly that the bat you play with is NOT going to help you much beyond the practice lvls. You will need to take time to practice the various returns, serves etc. This is where the type of bat comes in. Some are good for sheer speed, others for control and spin. But this isn‚Äôt easy to find. I earned several ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù bats with high spin and control. The problem was that I had absolutely no idea how to use them. Finding where I could switch the bats took some time. That is the major issue. I would like an easier menu to navigate so I don‚Äôt have to spend so much time looking for the bat I wish to use. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the skins either... they do NOTHING for your overall control and spin. They are nothing more than flash.
The controls are nice and snappy and smooth the only thing I‚Äôd say that would make this app better is a non local multiplayer so like maybe you can play with anyone with a code or random you know

title.label: Love table tennis? Get this game!!

content.label:
If you‚Äôve ever liked table tennis this is a really fun and well designed game. Sometimes I can‚Äôt get myself to stop playing for an hour or more. That said, there are some issues.

It is really not well suited for iPhones. The game must be played in landscape, and you need to swipe your finger up from the bottom of the screen for most shots. I wind up frequently pausing the game by accidentally starting a swipe too low on the screen and wind up on the home screen. It‚Äôs hugely annoying and I haven‚Äôt found a way to avoid it.

On an iPad Mini the play is much better but you‚Äôve still got to be careful of the same issue. On a full size iPad the game plays really great. The graphics are amazing and game play is very fluid and dynamic. You have to take some time to understand the best finger swipes but the game offers several modes including Quick Games and Career Mode so there‚Äôs lots of opportunity to get the hang of it.

Naturally, like all other games these days, you‚Äôll have to spend some money occasionally. Power Boosts seem to be required if you want to beat the virtual competitors and progress through the game at a reasonable pace, and the further you progress in the career mode the more often you‚Äôll be paying to power up, because they last for less and less time. I‚Äôve been through the Club phase and finished the Nationals, and I‚Äôve spent about $12, but it‚Äôs been worth every penny. 

Next comes the Internationals which I‚Äôm guessing is going to be really difficult. Most likely I‚Äôll be paying up for Boosts every session to make it thru the whole game. So far, though, the game is fun and challenging enough that I‚Äôve been willing to pay. I‚Äôll have to see how far my dollars go in the near future. One thing I really like is that if you get stuck in the more difficult levels, and can‚Äôt earn points to move along, you can always go back to challenges you‚Äôve beaten and earn points there, albeit at a much slower pace. 

In any case, I highly recommend it. It‚Äôs my favorite ‚Äògo to‚Äô game of all right now.
i truly love this game i always come back to it
The game is amazing but I‚Äôm trying to play with a friend on multiplayer which says stay on the same WiFi then it sends an invite which I don‚Äôt know how to accept it
Fun! Game it‚Äôs getting pretty Monotonous..... if we could battle against live opponents this game would be complete!!

I want to love this game, I really do. Graphics are terrific, could have a story of some kind for career but that is the small stuff.  What kills this game for me is that once you are past initial tournament it turns into a spin dominated game and trying to do anything but put spin or counter spin on a shot is a complete waste of time and leads to a loss and failure. I played tournaments in my youth and not every player out there can spin like a world champion but you wouldn‚Äôt know that in this game. It just gets way to boring to rally until you accidentally swipe to low and lose the screen on iPad or another glitch is paddle sticks in place or the opponent hits in the net on and easy return after a long boring rally like even the computer ai got bored. There are lots of different play styles out there but obviously the developers are fans of spin, spin, spin.
